captions.text: 11 Struggles curvy girls know too well.

- Ooh, these are so
cute, what s-, one size?!
There ain't no way in hell.
- I can't do it butt cheeks, can you?

- Dear Lord, we are here
today to bless the hands

Will you give me the
strength to fit into them.
Yup, this is out of control.

title: 11 Struggles Curvy Girls Know Too Well

comments.author: mintundeer

comments.text:
They should do a video on petite girls. Girl who are short but kind of 
curvy. Like me I am about 5'0 and although I an skinny, I still have 
curves. I know some of the struggles these woman are facing, except with a 
little tweak. Big bust but tiny back. I can never find a bra that fits. 
People ask me how much I weigh, either I weigh a lot or too little. Another 
struggle is maintaining body weight. I can eat whatever I want, and for a 
while it doesn't add up but Bam! I went from 95 to 105. It's a constant 
fluxuation, and my clothes never seem to fit right. Either to big or too 
small. ﻿
comments.author: Ossielovest

comments.text:
I'm a curvy gal too. My waist is always way smaller around 25- 30cm to my 
boobs and hip. I sometimes really hate my boobs becuz they keep shaking 
when I run and everyone will stare at them. I hate being watched by 
strangers =.=. But overall I am happy with my body becuz girls around me 
always compliment and wish to have sexy curves rather than being too flat.  
Guys love curvy girls too. And luckily I'm very fast and flexible cuz I am 
a dancer. But whatever your body type is, be confident and happy with them. 
Mind set is really important.﻿

comments.author: marckery blanchard

comments.text:
Even at a healthy weight for my BMI, I was still called fat. I thought 
there was something wrong with me because I couldn't fit into button-up 
tops, I wore holes in the inner thighs of my jeans, I had stretch marks, 
and I couldn't wear a string bikini without falling out of it. Growing up 
all I knew is that I had boobs early and fleshy thighs and calves and all 
my friends were skinny. It took until high school when one of my friends 
said I had "the perfect body" to start feeling more confident ever so 
gradually.﻿
